ngiemboon: Á la cʉ́ʼ pɔ́ páʼ njÿó ge lʉ́a mé jÿó línɔ̀ɔn pásékà, Yěsô ne ńzsé ngie ayé fʉ̀ʼ kǔʼ páʼ à ge fó tsɛ̀ɛ yɔɔn njÿó, é gʉa kẅɛ́te Tá we. Páʼ yé Yěsô lɔ̌ɔn ńkwoŋo pʉ̀a pie ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó ńgwɔ́ pé la, á kẅiʼi ńkwoŋo wɔ́b tà ńcʉ́me.
en: Before the Passover Festival, Jesus knew that his hour had come to depart from this world to the Father.   Having loved his own who were in the world,  # 13:1 Jn 1:11; 6:37 he loved them to the end.

ngiemboon: Ncwònzém gÿo ńgwɔ́, pâ pɔ̌ néŋe ssé léjÿó shúm. Á gwaa gwɔ́, mbà Sátà ně ńdáʼ ńnéŋ nkwaŋá lésẅiŋe Yěsô tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m Jẅíndà Isekalyɔd, á míŋ Símò.
en: Now when it was time for supper, the devil   had already put it into the heart of Judas,  # 13:2 Mk 3:19 Simon Iscariot’s son,  # 13:2 Or Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son to betray  # 13:2 Mt 10:4; Jn 12:4; 13:21 him.

ngiemboon: Yěsô ne ńzsé ngie Tá we la pú ńnéŋ shúm ntsèm mbwó yé, ńgíŋ ńne ńzsé ngie à la fó mbwó Ssé, à piŋ ne ńgee né lejʉ́ŋ Ssé.
en: Jesus knew that the Father had given everything into his hands,   that he had come from God,  # 13:3 Jn 8:42; 16:27; 17:8 and that he was going back to God.  # 13:3 Jn 8:14; 14:12; 16:28; 17:11

ngiemboon: Ńnéŋe tà ńdu ssé, ésẅɛ nzsǒ fÿɔ́g ye, ńnuŋe ssé, ḿbíi táagwèle ńtʉ́me zẅɛ̌ʼ yé.
en: So he got up from supper, laid aside his outer clothing,   took a towel, and tied it around himself.  # 13:4 Lk 12:37

ngiemboon: Ńnéŋ ntse tsɛ̀ɛ káŋ, ńzye lélɔg sɔg mekwò megàŋakwò pé, ńdɔgɔ táagwèle gẅie à la tʉ́me zẅɛ̌ʼ yé ńtsíʼi.
en: Next, he poured water into a basin and began to wash his disciples’ feet and to dry them with the towel tied around him.

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa tà ńkúu na Símò Piɛ, á gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ ge sɔg mekwò mɔ́ɔn lá!»
en: He came to Simon Peter,   who asked him, “Lord, are you going to wash my feet? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Ammó gie n ne ńgÿo, à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ ɔ́ le júʼ fʉ̀ʼɔɔn wɔ́. Táʼ, é ké gÿo júʼ.»
en: Jesus answered him, “What I’m doing you don’t realize now, but afterward you will understand.”

ngiemboon: Piɛ gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Azeŋe yɔ́ɔn, à lɔɔn ngwɔ́ ɔ́ le mekwò mɔ́ɔn sɔg.» Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «N dɔɔn te sɔg, mbà pɔ̀gɔ te gíŋ é gwɔ́ na tsɔ́ nò wɔ́.»
en: “You will never wash my feet,” Peter said.

ngiemboon: Símò Piɛ gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Á lɔɔn ngwɔ́ púʼu, me Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, te sɔg pɔ́ ndàʼ mekwò mɔ́ɔn, pú sɔg mbwó mɔ́ɔn pâ twó yɔ́ɔn.»
en: Simon Peter said to him, “Lord, not only my feet, but also my hands and my head.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn né yé ngie: «Á té ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé gíŋ sɔg mbùm nyìŋ gẅie à sɔ̌g nnɛ́ wɔ́. Á nue ngàŋ pǔ ńdʉ́a. Pi ee pɛ́ʼɛ̀, mbà mbùm gi lʉ̌a, e ké te gi metsèm wɔ́.»
en: “One who has bathed,” Jesus told him, “doesn’t need to wash anything except his feet, but he is completely clean. You are clean, but not all of you.”

ngiemboon: Ńgɔɔn púʼu, mélàʼmie à la ne ńzsé nyìŋ gẅie à ge gÿo sẅiŋe yé, tá ńgɔɔn ngie: «Mbùm gi metsèm kaa lʉ́a.»
en: For he knew who would betray him. This is why he said, “Not all of you are clean.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô sɔg mekwò mɔ́b tà ńtsẅé jʉʼ, ḿmaʼ nzsǒ ye, ńgíŋ ńnéŋe ssé léjÿó mmó, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Tà pi juʼú mmó gie e fóo légÿo na pi?
en: When Jesus had washed their feet and put on his outer clothing, he reclined again and said to them, “Do you know what I have done for you?

ngiemboon: Pi tóŋo wɔ́ɔn lê “Tsítsà” ńtóŋo wɔ́ɔn lê “Cʉ̀apʉ̀a”, ńgɔɔn shwóŋo nò, á nue n gee wɛ̌.
en: You call me Teacher and Lord #— #and you are speaking rightly, since that is what I am.

ngiemboon: Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie mèŋ Ndè, ńgwɔ́ Tsítsà, mèŋ sɔ̌g mekwò mí, mbà á zɛ́te ngie pi gí, pi ne sɔgɔ mekwò mí pi né pi.
en: So if I, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also ought to wash one another’s feet.

ngiemboon: N nyɛ̌ɛ gẅi fʉ̀ʼ légwɔ́ gie pi gí pi ge gÿo páʼ pi gyǎ n gÿo.
en: For I have given you an example,    that you also should do just as I have done for you.

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋo gẅí, kwàʼ nénʉ́, anzìʼi fàʼ te fáŋ ńtɔ́gɔ táfàʼ we wɔ́, angàŋntúm ké te fáŋ ńtɔ́gɔ nyìŋ gẅie à ne ńtúmo yé wɔ́.
en: “Truly I tell you, a servant is not greater than his master,   ,# 13:16 Jn 15:20 and a messenger is not greater than the one who sent him.

ngiemboon: Páʼ pi ne ńzsé fʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, pi lɔɔn ńgÿo púʼu, mbà pi ee pà shÿó mbòŋo.
en: If you know these things, you are blessed if you do them.

ngiemboon: N ké těen ńgɔɔn yɔɔn nò á mbwó pi metsèm wɔ́, n ne ńzsé pʉ̀a pie n da tsɔ́ʼɔ wɔ́b. Tá á poŋ ngie ammó gie mé la ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé, à pumte. Mé la ŋweʼe ngie: “Nyìŋ gẅie peg yé ne ńteme shúm léjÿó ńjÿó, à kéen sele nzèm mèŋ.”
en: “I’m not speaking about all of you; I know those I have chosen.    But the Scripture   # 13:18 Mt 26:54 must be fulfilled:   # 13:18 Mt 1:22 The one who eats my bread   # 13:18 Other mss read eats bread with me has raised his heel against me.   # 13:18 Ps 41:9,# 13:18 Ps 41:9

ngiemboon: N tʉ́ njÿó éshwóŋo gẅí fʉ̀ʼɔɔn tà mɔɔn menò gÿo ńtó, pi zẅíŋ ngie “N gee wó,” à gwɔ́ pɔ́ mèŋ.
en: I am telling you now before it happens,    so that when it does happen you will believe   # 13:19 Mk 11:24; Jn 3:16; Ac 10:43; Rm 10:9; 1Pt 1:8–10 that I am he.   # 13:19 Ex 3:14; Jn 8:24,58

ngiemboon: Tà mèŋ shwóŋo gẅí, kwàʼ nénʉ́, nyìŋ lɔɔn ńkúe nyìŋ gẅie n tumó yé, mbà à kúe pɔ́ wɔ́ɔn. Nyìŋ gẅie à pǐŋ ńkúe wɔ́ɔn, à kúe pɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à túmo wɔ́ɔn.»
en: Truly I tell you, whoever receives anyone I send receives me, and the one who receives    me receives him who sent me.”

ngiemboon: Yěsô gɔɔn púʼu, além yé tsɔ́ʼɔ tɛʼ, á shʉashʉa ńgɔɔn ngie: «Tà mèŋ shwóŋo gẅí, kwàʼ nénʉ́, atsɔ̌ tàʼ nyìŋ na pi ge sẅiŋe wɔ́ɔn.»
en: When   Jesus had said this, he was troubled in his spirit  # 13:21 Ps 51:12 and testified,  # 13:21 Jn 15:26; Ac 26:5 “Truly I tell you, one of you will betray me.”

ngiemboon: Megàŋakwò Yěsô júʼ, awɔ̌wɔ́ɔ sele ńdíe fɛ̌ we, pɔ́ té zsé nyìŋ gẅie à gɔɔn yé wɔ́.
en: The disciples started looking at one another #— #uncertain which one he was speaking about.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ tàʼ na megàŋakwò pé gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn ńkwoŋo yé tɛʼ, á gwɔ́ lejʉ́ŋ yé ńne ńjÿó mmó.
en: One of his disciples, the one Jesus loved,   was reclining close beside Jesus.  # 13:23 Lit reclining at Jesus’s breast; that is, on his right; Jn 1:18

ngiemboon: Símò Piɛ myɛʼ nÿɔ́g ńdɔg ńtsẅi ngie à zɛ́te ngie à gɔɔn wɔ́ wɔ́ɔ.
en: Simon Peter motioned to him to find out who it was he was talking about.

ngiemboon: Á lémte letuŋó Yěsô, ńzɛ́te yé ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, angàŋ aa wɔ̌?»
en: So he leaned back against Jesus and asked him, “Lord, who is it? ”

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Aa nyìŋ gẅie n ge cÿɔʼɔ pwɔ́ʼɔ mmó léjÿó, é náa mbwó yé.» Ńgɔɔn púʼu, ḿbíi pwɔ́ʼɔ mmó, ńcÿɔʼ. Ńnáa mbwó Jẅíndà Isekalyɔd, á míŋ Símò.
en: Jesus replied, “He’s the one I give the piece of bread to after I have dipped it.”    When he had dipped the bread,  # 13:26 Mk 14:20 he gave it to Judas, Simon Iscariot’s son.  # 13:26 Or Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son

ngiemboon: Jẅíndà gwɔ́ tà ńkẅé, Sátà kúu tsɛ̀ɛ ntʉ́m yé. Yěsô leen ńké ńgɔɔn né yé ngie: «Lwo sẅɛte ńgÿo mmó gie ɔ̀ gẅiin légÿo!»
en: After Judas ate the piece of bread, Satan   entered him. So Jesus told him, “What you’re doing, do quickly.”

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ sɔɔn nyìŋ na pʉ̀a pie é lâ jʉʼó, te júʼu nò gie Yěsô faʼa légɔɔn wɔ́.
en: None of those reclining at the table knew why he said this to him.

ngiemboon: Etsɔ̌ pʉ̀a ne ńkwaŋa ngie à gɔɔn ngie Jẅíndà gʉa ńjú sɔ́b lâ pɔ̌ shúm línɔ̀ɔn, ka pɔ́ ngie à náa mmó mbwó mepóŋ wɔ́ɔ, á nue yé zɔ lɔ̌ɔn ńgẅiin múɔ pɔ̀ɔn nkáb wɔb lâ pɔ̌.
en: Since Judas   kept the money-bag, some thought that Jesus was telling him, “Buy what we need for the festival,”  # 13:29 Jn 2:23 or that he should give something to the poor.

ngiemboon: Jẅíndà kẅé púʼu, ńgwóon fó ndá ńkẅɛ. Mbà nzěm ně síŋ.
en: After receiving the piece of bread, he immediately left. And it was night.

ngiemboon: Jẅíndà gwɔ́ tà fó ndá ńkẅɛ, Yěsô gɔɔn ngie: «Áa fʉ̀ʼɔɔn páʼɔɔn, mbà mé nǎa legúʼ mbwó Míŋ Nyìŋ. Mbà Míŋ Nyìŋ ka náa legúʼ mbwó Ssé.
en: When   he had left, Jesus said, “Now the Son of Man   # 13:31 Mk 2:10 is glorified, and God is glorified   # 13:31 Jn 11:4; 17:1; 1Pt 2:12 in him.   # 13:31 2Th 1:12; 1Jn 2:5

ngiemboon: Páʼ Míŋ Nyìŋ ka nǎa legúʼ mbwó Ssé la, e Ssé lé twó mbùm yé ge gÿo é náa legúʼ mbwó yé, tà ntyě té gíŋ sag wɔ́.
en: If God is glorified in him,    God will also glorify him in himself and will glorify him at once.

ngiemboon: Penkʉ́ pɔ́ɔn, pege te gíŋ ńnéŋe tà ntyě sag wɔ́. Pi ge gÿo ńne gwá faʼa wɔ́ɔn páʼ n ka gɔɔn mbwó pà Yúndà ngie ajʉʼ gie n gee né wó, pi te kuʼu létóo wó wɔ́. N gǐŋ ńgɔɔn yɛ̌ nò mbwó pi fʉ̀ʼɔɔn.
en: Little children, I am with you a little while longer.    You will look for me, and just as I told the Jews, so now I tell you, ‘Where I am going, you cannot come.’   # 13:33 Jn 8:21–22; 14:2; 16:5

ngiemboon: N ge ná lepʉ̌ sesẅé né pi, e gwɔ́ ngie: Pi kwoŋe pi né pi. Páʼ n da kwoŋo gẅí la, pi gí kwoŋe pi né pi.
en: “I give you a new command: Love one another. Just as I have loved you, you are also to love one another.

ngiemboon: Pi lɔɔn ńkwoŋe pi né pi, mbà mânyìŋ ntsèm ge zsé ngie pi ee megàŋakwò pɔ́ɔn.»
en: By this everyone will know that you are my disciples, if you love    one another.”

ngiemboon: Símò Piɛ zɛ́te yé ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, ɔ̀ gee pɔ́ né nzɔ̌.» Yěsô tsɔ́ʼɔ mbwó yé ngie: «Ajʉʼ gie n gee né wó, ɔ̀ te kuʼu lécʉ́me nzèm mèŋ fʉ̀ʼɔɔn wɔ́. Ɔ̀ ge táa tá cʉ́me nzèm mèŋ.»
en: “Lord,” Simon Peter said to him, “where are you going? ”

ngiemboon: Piɛ gɔɔn né Yěsô ngie: «Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, akɔ́ ge gÿo tá ń de gwóon ńcʉ́me nzèm gù wɔ́ɔ? N ge náa twó yɔ́ɔn é tíi gú.»
en: “Lord,” Peter asked, “why can’t I follow you now? I will lay down my life   for you.”  # 13:37 Mk 14:31

ngiemboon: Yěsô tsɔ́ʼ ngie: «Ɔ̀ gɔɔn ngie ɔ̀ ge náa twó jú é tíi wɔ́ɔn! Tà mèŋ shwóŋo gú, kwàʼ nénʉ́, mênkɔ̀ʼ ge gÿo gwaa tóŋ lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn, mbà ɔ̀ moŋé wɔ́ɔn ngʉ̀a ntá.»
en: Jesus replied, “Will you lay down your life for me? Truly I tell you, a rooster will not crow until you have denied me three times.
